str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Publius, a governor of Malta. Of Latin origin; apparently 'popular'; Poplius, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.
A fever, scorching heat. From puresso; inflamed, i.e. feverish.
And, even, also, namely.
Dysentery. From dus- and a comparative of entos; a 'dysentery'.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A hand.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
